location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, at Bombay to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has resulted in a hole in the fabric of the folio. As a result, a small part of the body of the letter has been obscured.

mods.abstract: The letter is acknowledging the commands of the Bombay Government, dated 7 February 1822, respecting the restoration of two boats belonging to Ahmed Uzem [Aḥmad ‘Aẓīm], including the boat purchased from him by the Broker at Mocka [Al-Mukhā]. It outlines the measures that have been taken to affect this outcome.
